answers.answer: I think I would just show up at my Dr. office this AM (if he is there) and just sit there until they could work me in!!

he's not in on Friday's he does his surgeries on Friday....and he knows I was in the ER the ER called him cause he was in the same building and after he was done with the delivery he could have came over but he just told the ER you can go ahead and treat her....

Is there someone else you can go see?... That ob seems just too busy and for not checking your protein every month is just crazy..thats the first thing that is done on a check up... bp weight and then pee.yea... anytime you have even a question pertaining your heart... they go extreem. better safe then sorry.

I would def find a new doctor, one with a little bit more compassion maybe? Not saying that your doctor is bad, but it's obvious you are very worried about all of this and have made that clear to them! I just don't see why they aren't reassuring you that things are okay!!

I think he's a good Dr I just think his nurses like to pretned they are Dr's and keep telling me I'm fine....he is a very busy Dr accoding to anyone ou ask he's the best in these parts but i'm not so much aggreeing I'm worried they aren't checking into all options and just pushing me around I hate to go to another Dr but there has to be someone that will listen....and help calm my nerves.....I wonder if I could have a one time visit with another DR.....
That stinks.I've been having some weird heart skipping and fast beating too.  I think it's due to all the stress though.  Please keep us posted and take care of yourself!
sure you can, women do it all the time, just call someone and ask for a consultation.

I have a friend that works at another OB's office and I don't want to use the DR cause I don't like him but I don't want him to think I'm using him......I just want a dang urine test to calm my freaking nerves....

do you have a planned parenthood close to you? There has to be something you can do, maybe a place like that would have a list of local doctors and maybe even ones they highly recommend... that isn't your doctor. Some doctors just get a client load and it makes their schedules tight but if you have a real concern it should be addressed!

We have a health department....that's where I went yesterday and they told me my heart was skipping beats.  I wonder if my regular general practictioner could do the urine test to calm my nerves.....i know him really good and I go to church with him....

I would call and explain what's going on and tell them your ob doctor just hasn't ever did a urine test and you don't know why but you are really nervous something could be going on.. maybe they will fit you in somewhere!
I think I'll call him and see about getting in this afternoon and see if they will do a urine test.
ok so my GP isn't in today should I call him at home.....I mean he could at least tell me something right?

Yeah, if you are friends I don't think he would mind, DH calls his Doctor friend all the time with questions! Usually they meet for Lunch and a good game of racketball so it doesn't seem like they are just business friends.. I would try, what would it hurt, then maybe he will keep a closer eye on you and help you stay on top of things when he sees you in church!
Ok I'll call him at home.....

ahh no answer I wonder if they are out of town....if nothing else i might go to the clinic I was at yesterday and see if they will check on things....since the nurse there was concerned and seemed to be listening to me

yes, I would definitely try that since you seem to be getting no where else. She does sound like she may listen to you when no one else will. I mean.. she is the one who saw that your pulse was racing like a bandit!
doesn't hurt to try...

I can't seem to get through my concerns to anyone else.....heck I just want a dang pee test to calm my gosh dern nerves.....I had wondered why I never had gotten one.....my mom is even mad she went to him with my sister and he had her get one every time then....that was 12 years ago.
really all they do is have you pee in a cup and then they stick a little like paper stick thing in to test the level.. they don't even send it to a lab...

When are urine tests performed?A urine test should be expected during your first prenatal exam and then at least periodically in future prenatal visits. It would be normal for your healthcare provider to monitor your urine during each visit.What does the urine test look for?A urine tests is used to assess bladder or kidney infections, diabetes, dehydration and preeclampsia by screening for high levels of sugars, proteins, ketones and bacteria. High levels of sugars may suggest gestational diabetes, which may develop around the 20th week of pregnancy. Higher levels of protein may suggest a possible urinary tract infection, or kidney disease. Preeclampsia may be a concern if higher levels of protein are found later in pregnancy, combined with high blood pressure.

Oh yeah, you definitely want a urine test every appointment! or whenever you request it if you think something is not right!!!!!!!!!!!!! that's their job!!!Girl, are you sure you don't wanna look into gettin a new OB?? maybe it sounds scary to switch right in the middle of your PG, but in the long run, you need to trust them just as much as your family!! they will deliver YOUR babies! =SGood luck to you girl!

Hmm.  You know, I have little patience for nurses or doctors in a practice that I'm forking over a lot of money to, and who act like I'm overreacting or putting them out.  My RE is considered one of the best in our city, and though he's definitely done his job by helping get me pregnant, his staff has annoyed me so many times I had decided if this round of injectibles didn't work, I would go elsewhere.  I'm very low maintenance... I rarely have called to ask questions.  In the past 2 months I've called twice, both times with valid concerns.  I was passing blood and tissue one time, and the other my eyesight had gone completely blurry and I couldn't see.  Both times NOBODY bothered to call me back!!!The thing is, no matter how reputable your doctor is, you need to feel comfortable that when you have a concern, it is addressed to your satisfaction and that you aren't made to feel intimidated or embarassed to express your concerns!  You've got a high risk pregnancy and aren't asking for anyone to bend over backwards.  You just want to pee in a cup and get a urinalysis for goodness sake!Murphy's Law about your heart... of course nothing will happen with the monitor on, but as soon as you take it off, you'll get the fluttering again! I've had that happen to me.Personally, I would find another OB/GYN, tell them up front on your first visit about your concerns with the other doctor, what you need from them, and then decide if you'll stick with who you have or switch over.I hope everything goes okay for you!  Try not to stress too badly.  If your blood pressure was okay, likely you're all right but it's best to get your concerns immediately addressed by whoever is willing to address them!Sheri

I think I will look into another Ob  and go to both and then deceide after seeing both which one I prefer.....but good news is I can buy those urine tests at Walgreens and take them at home if he doesn't deceide to listen...but I am worried why they don't do them,......and I'm thinking my OB being so great this far was just to get me to for sure use him as a Dr....I mean he's came in 2-3 times after hours or on the weekend to do u/s when I have bleeding but for some reason now I guess he feels l have no need to be concerned....but the point is I am.....and I am high risk and I've lost 3 babies already I don't want to add two more to it if I can prevent it.

its good they sent you home with the heart monitor.my sister was going through some things...(not pregnant) having heart racing, pounding out of her chest...then she'd go to dr. and cardiologist and be fine...so they sent her home with a monitor... and only after viewing what happened at home were they able to see the irregularities.they put her on something to regulate her heart beat...but then it slowed her bp down too much, sothey had to change it a few times till they got it right.

question: Ok so I wemt to the clinic like my Dr's nurse told me for a manual BP check and strangely enough my BP was fine....but she said my pule was way out of whack....she kept telling me my heart would skip beats and totally quit for a bit.....so I should call my OB and let them know....so I did and the nurse went on to tell me my Dr was about to leave for a delivery so I should go to the ER and they would send me to Labor and delivery where he was......did that happen?  No....I was in the ER for 2 hours them trying to get an ok to send me to labor and delivery....and finally they said we'll just keep you here....I told them all my symptoms and they hooked me up to everything under the sun.  And even did and EKG....everything was perfectly normal the whole time I was there....my BP 127/70 never went higher my pule 99-110 never went higher.....everything looked fine they still wouldn't listen to me about wanting a urine test but the did draw blood and said it all looked good.  They didn't even once check my babies to make sure they were ok...so now I have to wear a heart monitor and stil have no answers.....I don't know what to do I still feel like they are missing something.
title: My wonderful night
